title.text: The SENSEVAL-3 Multilingual English-Hindi Lexical Sample Task

abstractContent.text: This paper describes the English-Hindi Multilingual lexical sample task in SENSEVAL-3.
Rather than tagging an English word with a sense from an En-glish dictionary, this task seeks to assign the most appropriate Hindi translation to an ambiguous target word.
Training data was solicited via the Open Mind Word Expert (OMWE) from Web users who are fluent in English and Hindi.

introductionContent.text: The goal of the MultiLingual lexical sample task is to create a framework for the evaluation of systems that perform Machine Translation, with a focus on the translation of ambiguous words.

The task is very similar to the lexical sample task, except that rather than using the sense inventory from a dictionary we follow the suggestion of) and use the translations of the target words into a second language.
In this task for SENSEVAL-3, the contexts are in English, and the "sense tags" for the English target words are their translations in Hindi.
This paper outlines some of the major issues that arose in the creation of this task, and then describes the participating systems and summarizes their results.
